title: Bug 49299 - Incorrect behavior with custom cookie name and URL rewriting
description: In chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is mentioned that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will be used as the name of the URI parameter when the session ID is encoded in the URL (assuming URL rewriting is enabled). However, the actual behavior is different. The page sends a cookie with the following details: SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly But the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid' instead of 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE'. Observed Behavior (OB): The page sends the following cookie: SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly But the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid': http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4 Expected Behavior (EB): According to the information in section 7.1.1, I would expect the Reload link to be: http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F Steps to Reproduce (SR): 1. Deploy the attached war file (cookiename.war) 2. Open the web application in a browser 3. Observe the value of the session cookie and the Reload link
